CRD_ROM_BeMyGod.synopsis: After learning of the Crown of Karsus and the way it means potential ascension, Gale invites the players to share in his potential divinity. He brings them to an illusory part of the Outer planes, where they sail through the stars on a boat.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive.synopsis: Gale absorbed dangerous shadow magic from a morally dubious source, in defiance of Mystra's command that he dispel it. Tara picks up on this, leading to a short conversation where he can tell her about it or not.

CRD_SpellTeaching2.synopsis: In this scene, Gale is conjuring an image of Mystra over the palm of his hand, staring at the goddess he’s love with, but who abandoned him. When the player approaches, he dispels the image and he feels embarrassed to have been caught doing what he was doing. The conversation turns to his passion for magic however, and he invites the player to try to cast a spell with him together. The player can do so by passing through various stages of spell casting, and when successful, this can lead to a first player-initiated romantic moment with Gale.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.synopsis: Gale encountered a source of dangerous shadow magic, and obeyed Mystra's sign that he should dispel it, therefore resisting the urge to use it. This triggers a letter from Elminster, who retracts his previous support for Mystra's instruction, and tells Gale he has the option to find another way to defeat the absolute.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_32.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_32.text: I owe you an apology. Things became quite heated between us before, after I learned of the Crown of Karsus. I allowed myself to get carried away, and failed to properly explain myself.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_162.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_162.text: Thank you. But I owe you more than that. I need to help you understand just what this could mean for us.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_45.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_45.text: Perhaps now is the time to explain then.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_66.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_66.text: Apologies are useless if you're still intent on doing something dangerous.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_94.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_94.text: When are we not doing something dangerous? Give me a chance - I think I can help you understand.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_103.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_103.text: I can't. Your opinion matters greatly to me. Give me a chance - I think I can help you understand.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_55.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_55.text: Ah. You're still talking to me then?

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_7.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_7.text: I wouldn't blame you for giving me a wide berth. I thought the orb's ever-present censure had tamed my wilder ambition, but that wasn't the case.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_76.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_76.text: I needed Mystra's intervention. She offered me a path to redemption at last, and it might yet leave my mind and body intact.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_1.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_1.text: Please - continue to believe in me. I want to show you the wizard I am capable of being, rather than the poor excuse for a man who's kept you company thus far.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_95.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_95.text: I believe in you Gale. Always have, always will.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_37.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_37.text: That's all I ever need to hear.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_104.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_104.text: I know what I must do. The Crown belongs under Mystra's stewardship, not mine, and I will ensure she gets it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_71.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_71.text: That means there'll be no permanent place in the heavens for us. But we could still visit.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_154.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_154.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player closes their eyes and the screen briefly fades to black. Gale speaks over black, casting a spell.NodeContext: Latin spellcasting - ass-tra navi-gah-mus ('we sail the stars')

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_49.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_49.text: Few mortals ever glimpse what you're about to see. But don't be alarmed - I'm here with you. Now... open your eyes.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Black screen. Gale speaks in VO

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade up from black as the player opens their eyes to a dazzling spectacle. They and Gale are now sitting in a small boat that shimmers with iridescent light. Unpiloted, it silently meanders through a majestic, infinite starfield.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_135.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_135.text: Quite the view, isn't it? The Outer Planes are a place of profound, sometimes overwhelming possibility.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_167.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_167.text: I conjured this illusion often during my confinement in Waterdeep. An escape for the mind, where there was none for the body.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_50.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_50.text: It was easier to stare at the celestial abyss than recognise the emptiness within myself. Easier to pretend my destiny lay among such stars, than work to salvage a life on solid ground. You changed all that.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_27.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_27.text: Just what am I agreeing to?

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_119.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_119.text: No, Gale. Whatever you have to show me - I don't need it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_150.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_150.text: No matter. Far be it for me to impose the majesty of the celestial canvas on those unwilling to partake of its beauty.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_150.context: NodeContext: A bit miffed but trying to take it on the chin

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_62.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_62.text: Enjoy the rest of your evening.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_53.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_53.text: You're willing to give up the chance of unlimited power. I'd say your ambition is under control.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_168.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_168.text: If that's true, it's thanks to you, and the trust you show in me at every turn of this strange adventure of ours.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_160.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_160.text: I hope so, because honestly you have been a poor man recently. Especially on the romance front...

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_123.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_123.text: I'm sorry. It's not easy living for more than just yourself, when for so long just staying alive was accomplishment enough.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_31.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_31.text: You're more to me than magic, Gale.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_112.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_112.text: You stole the words from my mouth.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_70.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_70.text: I don't think I deserve you at times. I told you of my ambitions - the likes of which many would baulk at - and yet you remain at my side.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_2.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_2.text: You're welcome - but don't put yourself down. You deserve me, and a lot more besides.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_101.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_101.text: It gladdens me to hear you say that. Perhaps I can show my gratitude another way - by demonstrating exactly what ascension will mean to me. To us.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_14.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_14.text: I'll stand by you. But some further explanation of what you intend wouldn't go amiss.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_79.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_79.text: Words alone are not enough. Permit me to show you. Please, close your eyes a moment.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_163.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_163.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player closes their eyes and the screen briefly fades to black. Gale speaks over black, casting a spell.NodeContext: Latin spellcasting - ass-tra navi-gah-mus ('we sail the stars')

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_83.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_83.text: Few mortals ever glimpse what you're about to see. But don't be alarmed - I'm here with you. Now... open your eyes.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Black screen. Gale speaks in VO

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade up from black as the player opens their eyes to a dazzling spectacle. They and Gale are now sitting in a small boat that shimmers with iridescent light. Unpiloted, it silently meanders through a majestic, infinite starfield.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_165.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_165.text: The Outer Planes. This is where gods dwell. Where they observe us from afar. Where they make play-things of us.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_23.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_23.text: They would keep all of this from us - the power, the possibilities. They only want us to serve them, pray to them... and ultimately, die for them.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_108.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_108.text: But what if we didn't need them? What if we wielded their power instead, and helped ourselves in all the ways they refuse to. I could make that happen. I could make this illusion a reality, with you by my side.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_108.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_159.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_159.text: You're still determined to do this, after all that was said?

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_107.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_107.text: How could I not crave this? But I don't want it for myself, alone - I want you at my side, willing and wholehearted.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_107.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_39.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_39.text: You know how I feel. I've already voiced my support.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_137.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_137.text: Yes, you have. But I want more than your support. I want your heart.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_137.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_155.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_155.text: Are you saying you want to ascend? Claim godhood?

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_164.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_164.text: No, not like that. I don't want to join them, I want to better them. A god's powers, paired with a mortal conscience, a mortal heart.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_164.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_54.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_54.text: I don't need the stars, Gale. I have you.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_133.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_133.text: Then have me - but have the best possible version of me.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_126.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_126.text: You'd defy Mystra? As if we need more enemies.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_93.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_93.text: I've already defied Mystra. Had I followed her command, there'd be nothing left of me but a smoking crater.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_60.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_60.text: The tadpoles, the orb - these threats to our existence - the gods could aid us if they wished, but instead they cower behind Ao. So let us act ourselves.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.NodeContext: Ao = AY-oh (an overlord deity that most gods answer to)

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_114.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_114.text: With the power of the crown, any foe would be rendered impotent. Any obstacle would be dwarfed by our might.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_35.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_35.text: I used to believe Mystra's forgiveness was worth dying for. But I was wrong. You showed me just how much I have to live for.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_128.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_128.text: With you, I forget my goddess. I love you.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_41.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_41.text: Tell me you feel the same way. Tell me you want what I want. Please.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_113.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_113.text: I feel the same. Whatever you need of me, consider it done.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_73.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_73.text: Right now, I need nothing more than a kiss. Then we'll face what is to come, together. And claim the crown when the time comes.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_40.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_40.text: You know I would if I could. But I'll sit with you as long as you'll have me.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_61.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_61.text: Let's not grow complacent - that path you speak of is sure to be a dangerous one.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_5.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_5.text: No doubt it will be - abominably so. As is just about everything we do. But I know we're up to the task. Are you still with me?
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_139.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_139.text: Wait. Perhaps I'm being too hasty... and perhaps you're overreaching.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_16.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_16.text: I love you. But for the man that you are. Not the god you'd pretend to be.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_87.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_87.text: But think what I offer. The vastness of eternity to explore, the Weave at our fingertips... You would really prefer me as I am?
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_87.context: NodeContext: Genuine, vulnerable - the player just told him they loved him in a way that no one else has

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_3.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_3.text: Stop his protests with a kiss.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_30.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_30.text: Stop his protests with a kiss.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_144.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_144.text: You're right. We should not deny ourselves such a gift. The crown must be ours.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_124.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_124.text: I don't know what to say.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_121.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_121.text: Say yes. But if words fail you, I'll accept a kiss.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_110.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_110.text: No doubt it will be - abominably so. As is just about everything we do. But I know we're up to the task. What do you say...?
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_25.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_25.text: This is wrong, Gale. That power will corrupt you, even if you can seize it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_67.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_67.text: It won't, I swear to you. It's merely a tool - a means to an end.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_33.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_33.text: You told me once to choose you, the one who loved me. That's what this is all about. Do you doubt me?
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale's expression wilts with disappointment. Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_89.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_89.text: If you believe this can be done, then I will believe too.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_148.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_148.text: You mean... you want the same as I do?
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.NodeContext: Hope rising again

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_158.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_158.text: Yes. I want you to seize the crown, and make us a new world.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_152.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_152.text: I've never wanted to kiss you more than I do now.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_109.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_109.text: Yes. I want you to seize the crown, and make us a new world.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_15.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_15.text: Yes. I want you to seize the crown, and make us a new world.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_28.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_28.text: Then it will be so. With you and I together, there's not a force in existence that can stop us.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_138.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_138.text: I can't, Gale. This is best forgotten. I love you as you are.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale's shoulders sag. The starfield around seems to dim. Distant points of light vanish into the infinite dark.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_122.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_122.text: What more is there to be said?
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_166.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_166.text: Plenty, in time. This doesn't have to be the end for us - just forget the crown.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_117.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_117.text: But I could be so much more to you.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_117.context: CinematicNodeContext: Crestfallen expression. Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.NodeContext: crestfallen

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_96.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_96.text: You're already everything I need you to be.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_20.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_20.text: I hope you're right. I truly do. Godly power, perhaps I can live without, but you? You're everything.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Expression brightening up. Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player and Gale are seated facing each other but do not lean in to kiss.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_18.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_18.text: You put the stars to shame. Let's sit here another while - I want to drink you in.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat drifts away amidst the stars. (No touching)

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_48.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_48.text: You see me as I am, and do not find me wanting. With these stars as my witness, I swear - you will always be enough for me.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_85.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player and Gale lean in to kiss while seated facing each other.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_0.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_0.text: You put the stars to shame. Let's sit here another while - I want to drink you in.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat drifts away amidst the stars.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_9.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_9.text: You see me as I am, and do not find me wanting. With these stars as my witness, I swear - you will always be enough for me.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_146.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_146.text: Say nothing. Answer him with a kiss instead.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_149.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_149.text: Say nothing. Answer him with a kiss instead.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_118.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_118.text: Enough. If you won't see sense, just take me back.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_131.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_131.text: As you wish. Take a moment to soak the view. I doubt you will be privy to it again.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_131.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is sitting in a boat; record on a chair or a bench. Search mocap context for the pose, Greg will post it.NodeContext: Resigned.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: The remaining stars blink out like snuffed candles, leaving only the faint glow of the boat. Gale and the player sit silently for a moment. The scene fades fully to black.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_151.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_151.text: This folly is your own - I want nothing to do with it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_91.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_91.text: I don't doubt your motivations, but do this, and you will match Karsus' folly with your own.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_106.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_106.text: You plan to dethrone the gods themselves - it's lunacy.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_143.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_143.text: Just what am I agreeing to?

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_47.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_47.text: A little boat voyage, that's all. Indulge me.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Coy smileNodeContext: A little cheeky/coy. Holding back a surprise he's arranged.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_125.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_125.text: No, Gale. I've indulged you enough.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_78.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_78.text: I suppose if you see it that way... there's little else to be said, is there. Enjoy your evening.
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Crestfallen expressionNodeContext: Quietly devastated after the player rebuffs him.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_77.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_77.text: I'm starting to regret our relationship. What am I even getting myself into?

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_29.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_29.text: Remain steadfast - there is nothing to fear from what awaits me. In fact... allow me to show you. Words alone are not enough.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_82.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_82.text: Please, close your eyes a moment.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_72.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_72.text: There you are. I was worried you might have second thoughts after my little confrontation with Mystra.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_157.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_157.text: Most would think me foolish, deluded even, for daring to pursue dreams of wielding Karsus' Crown. I do not take your faith lightly.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_80.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_80.text: Ah, you've a moment for me? I was hoping to speak to you - I confess, my thoughts have been somewhat scattered since my audience with Mystra.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_13.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_13.text: The Karsite Weave could offer more than just power - it could bestow divinity. If I only trust myself to wield it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_127.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_127.text: I know this may not be the course you would choose for me, but before you protest - you should at least know what it is you would be advising against.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_132.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_132.text: A pity I did not learn all she had to offer, but the fact that she summoned me to her presence is proof enough that the Crown of Karsus is worth pursuing.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_84.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_84.text: I must admit, the Crown of Karsus has occupied my every thought since I learned of it. If I can seize it, and use it... the possibilities for both of us are infinite.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_111.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_111.text: I must admit, the Crown of Karsus has occupied my every thought since we learned of it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_42.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_42.text: If we can seize it, and use it... the possibilities are endless. Yet you haven't uttered a peep one way or the other about it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_36.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_36.text: The power to change the world - it may be within our reach. You must have an opinion, surely.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_56.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_56.text: I'm here to support you, no matter what you want.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_24.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_24.text: So much power will only prove dangerous. You should forget it.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_52.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_52.text: But I cannot. You would  not be able to either, if you knew what I knew. Please, allow me to show you. Just close your eyes a moment.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_115.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_115.text: I don't know what to say. How can I respond to something so... immense? It's beyond comprehension.

CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_134.speaker: Gale
CRD_ROM_BeMyGod_134.text: Then the fault lies with me, and my inadequate words. Please, allow me to show you instead. Just close your eyes a moment.

CRD_StandingByTheWizard_6.speaker: Player
CRD_StandingByTheWizard_6.text: |We have a better chance to keep you from blowing up together.|

CRD_StandingByTheWizard_4.speaker: Gale
CRD_StandingByTheWizard_4.text: |Well it's nice to be liked enough for people to choose horrible, necrotic death by your side, I guess.|

CRD_StandingByTheWizard_3.speaker: Gale
CRD_StandingByTheWizard_3.text: |I am really in a poor state. So tired. Might explode any day. Any night.|

CRD_StandingByTheWizard_11.speaker: Gale
CRD_StandingByTheWizard_11.text:
|That was a very... passionate plea you held on my behalf.
Why so?|

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_27.context: InternalNodeContext: Gale has never chosen to disobey Mystra, but he's never chosen to act in favour of Mystra, either.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_17.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_17.text: I passed up an opportunity to serve Mystra's will. To give her a sign I've changed.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_13.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_13.text: I was curled up here quite comfortably when I was suddenly overcome with uneasiness. A tressym's intuition is rarely wrong. What's happened?

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_18.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_18.text: I indulged in some dark magic to create a Shadow Lantern.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_34.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_34.text: You've a keen eye, Tara. I drew power from a source of shadow magic.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_2.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_2.text: I think I felt Mystra's presence...

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_31.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_31.text: You did? Well that is a turn-up for the books. And what led her to grace you with her presence?
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_31.context: NodeContext: A little bit of suspicion. Tara is not so sure about Mystra lately.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_12.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_12.text: I indulged in some dark magic to create a Shadow Lantern.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_10.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_10.text: You did what? What the devil has gotten into you?

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_19.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_19.text: You may as well leave your life lessons in a bucket, for all the good they do you.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_25.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_25.text: Good. Then she's speaking sense, at last.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_5.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_5.text: I promise - these shadow powers will help us, even if they are... impure.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_22.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_22.text: I'll believe it when I see it, and not a moment before.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_20.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_20.text: The lantern will be useful to us. And I'll be sure to wield it carefully.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_35.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_35.text: Just because Mystra demands my life, doesn't mean I do her dirty work. I make my own choices.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_32.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_32.text: I know exactly what I'm doing. Taking the power I deserve to wield.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_28.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_28.text: I have a strategy in mind. One that involves not willingly provoking Mystra's anger.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_0.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_0.text: Is that so? Then we'd best hope you don't make any further miscalculations. We both know what happened the last time you took something you thought you deserved.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_26.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_26.text: Be very careful, Mr Dekarios. You're on a terrifying road. One misstep could be your last. And then I'd be - oh, terribly cranky.
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_26.context: NodeContext: She's making light of how sad she'd be if Gale died.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_23.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_23.text: I drew power from a source of shadow magic. A corpse, to be specific.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_3.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_3.text: Well, she has a funny way of showing it, doesn't she, considering what she's asked of you?

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_14.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_14.text: I trust you'll treat whatever she had to say with the required lashings of salt. Better to keep your own wisdom than hers, Mr Dekarios. Or better yet, keep mine.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_8.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_8.text: A private matter. Nothing to concern yourself with.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_11.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_11.text: Oh, but I do concern myself, Mr Dekarios. Even when you're being as annoying as you are now.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_21.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_21.text: Nothing you need to be concerned about.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_16.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_16.text: I'll leave you to your secrets, Mr Dekarios, but allow me to remind you of a simple fact. We rarely hide that which we know is right.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_163.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Gale holds out his arm. Above the palm of his hand is conjured in gold-coloured magic the image of a woman, the goddess Mystra. He's looking at the figure intensely.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_30.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_30.text: Is that Mystra I see in the palm of your hands? An ambitious spell indeed.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_44.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_44.text: Oh! My, you startled me. I... I was miles away.
CRD_SpellTeaching2_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Startled, he dispells it.NodeContext: Gale is looking at a miniature magical projection of Mystra he's created in his hand in his hand. Startled, he dispells it.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_47.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_47.text: Of course, of course. I was just... practising an incantation.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_168.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_168.text: I do - because it's through practice that I seek to perfect. To augment.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_174.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_174.text: I'll leave you to it then. Good night.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_32.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_32.context: NodeContext: Distracted. Still miles away in his head.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_136.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_136.text: There's more to it than that. The figure I saw: she means something to you.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_71.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_71.context: NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_216.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_216.text: I can't quite describe it, the need I sometimes feel to see her - to draw the filaments of fantasy into existence.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_67.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_67.text: No sculpture or painting could ever do her justice, only the fabric that she herself is and embodies:

CRD_SpellTeaching2_34.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_34.text: Mystra is all magic. And as far as I'm concerned, she is all creation.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_138.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_138.text: I didn't realise the depth of your devotion.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_98.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_98.text: You sound like a smitten school boy.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_251.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_251.text: It is a kind of love after all; at the very least a most deep seated passion.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_0.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_0.text: You're deluded, Gale. There's more to life than one goddess.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_187.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_187.text: I quite agree. There's no greater deity than Mystra.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_95.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_95.text: You speak a great truth. No other god other comes close to her divinity.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_28.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_28.text: Careful, Gale. The other gods are just as important. My own, for example.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_100.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_100.text: No, but you do understand, don't you?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_27.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_27.text: Magic is... my life. I've been in touch with the Weave for as long as I can remember. There's nothing like it.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_194.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_194.text: It's like music, poetry, physical beauty all rolled into one and given expression through the senses.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_15.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_15.text: That is why I asked you to seek me out, to offer you a taste of such wonders. Would you like me to show you?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_209.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_209.text: Would you like to experience this?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_137.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_137.text: I'd be glad to try, though I normally commune with Mystra through prayer.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_131.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Gale walks around behind the player (as though teaching them to fly a kite) and makes a delicate gesture with both hands.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_234.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player imitates the gesture. There’s a first visual effect. Some sparks of magic start to appear around the player and Gale.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_243.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_243.text: *A familiar feeling - like a kind word and a kind touch at the same time. It's warm and comfortable.*

CRD_SpellTeaching2_231.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_231.text: Imitate the gesture quickly and decisively.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_146.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_146.text: Imitate the gesture slowly and as precisely as you can.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_33.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_33.text: Imitate the gesture with a flourish.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_211.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_211.text: *You feel something strange - like a kind word and a kind touch at the same time. It's warm and comfortable.*

CRD_SpellTeaching2_110.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_110.text: Excellent. Now repeat after me: Ah-Thran Mystra-Ryl Kantrach-Ao.
CRD_SpellTeaching2_110.context: NodeContext: The line can be read just like the words appear, but with some mystical gravitas in the pronunciation. I picture this spoken the way Morgana speaks the Charm of Making in the following clip from Excalibur: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ttq_4FwvLJo&gl=BE (First result when searching for “excalibur charm of making” on youtube.)

CRD_SpellTeaching2_169.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_169.text: An easy incantation. Simply repeat after Gale.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_199.context: CinematicNodeContext: The visual effect intensifies. There’s the start of a glow, of a rush of beautiful magic.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_190.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_190.text: *Ah, yes: the scent of rosewater and a sense of wellbeing. A sliver of Weave that tastes sweet on the tongue.*

CRD_SpellTeaching2_85.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_85.text: Repeat the words, slowly, but carefully.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_195.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_195.text: You sense power in these words. Speak them deliberately.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_40.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_40.text: *Suddenly: the scent of rosewater and a sense of wellbeing. A sliver of Weave that tastes sweet on the tongue.*

CRD_SpellTeaching2_218.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_218.text: Very good. Now I want you to picture in your mind the concept of harmony. As true as you can.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_208.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_208.text: Recede into the calm centre of your mind, just like you were taught at the academy.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_60.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_60.text: Still your mind. Focus on Mystra's grace. Her power. The peace you find in following her wisdom.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_223.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_223.text: Sink deep into your magic. It is who you are. It is home.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_48.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_48.text: Harmony comes easily to you. Allow it to wash over your mind and magic.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Gale are now fully enveloped in a magic glow - a protective field of beautiful magic. Unconsciously player steps back closer to Gale.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_123.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_123.text: *You see - or is it sense? - the unmistakable presence of Mystra, the Lady of Mysteries.*

CRD_SpellTeaching2_233.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_233.text: *There's something like the anticipation of a kiss, then the pleasure of being cloaked in peace.*

CRD_SpellTeaching2_154.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_154.text: *You are safe. You are nestled in the cup of Mystra's hand.*

CRD_SpellTeaching2_73.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_73.text: *You are safe. You are nestled in the cup of her hand.*

CRD_SpellTeaching2_68.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_68.text: Look at that. We're channelling the Weave. How does it feel?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_159.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_159.text: You did it. You're channelling the Weave. How does it feel?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_214.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_214.text: Incredible. Though of course, I could have managed it by myself...

CRD_SpellTeaching2_17.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_17.text: You're hard to please, aren't you?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_13.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_13.text: *The Weave connects you. The moment feels intimate.*

CRD_SpellTeaching2_171.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_171.text: Hold on to the moment. It's a good night for intimacy.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_18.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_18.text: *You realise the Weave is making you one. You have but to imagine your desire, and Gale will know it.*
CRD_SpellTeaching2_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: The magic glow is at its peak. It makes the player and Gale look like the only people in the world, safe in their own miniature dimension.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_228.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_228.text: Picture kissing him. With tenderness. Then, with passion.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_62.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_62.text: Picture a romantic walk, your hand slipped within Gale's.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_21.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_21.text: *You perceive quick-fire gusts of embarrassment, trepidation, and finally... elation.*

CRD_SpellTeaching2_244.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_244.text: Sorry, I wasn't expecting... But it is a pleasant image to be sure!

CRD_SpellTeaching2_183.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_183.text: Most pleasant, in fact. Most welcome.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_29.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_29.text: *The Weave evaporates, and as it does so, you realise the night feels suddenly cold and lonesome.*
CRD_SpellTeaching2_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: All that beautiful magic slips away, and as it does, the player and Gale find themselves in the here and now again.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_99.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_99.text: There it goes. How easily things slip away from us, no matter how hard they were in the obtaining.
CRD_SpellTeaching2_99.context: NodeContext: The weave disappears – he says this with a passionate melancholy.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_46.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_46.text: Good night. I enjoyed sharing a moment of magic with you.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_254.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_254.text: Picture a hearty meal with Gale, food and friendship flowing between you.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_43.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_43.text: Picture kicking him in the gut.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_41.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_41.context: NodeContext: Gale and the player are bonded by the Weave, allowing the player to conjure an image in Gale’s head that projects your feelings towards him. In this node, the player pictured hitting him in the stomach, which he does not quite appreciate.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_252.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_252.text: There it goes. I suppose a blow to the stomach upsets the Weave as much as it would me.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_103.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_103.text: I'm going to bed. Perhaps this was all a mistake.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_185.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_185.text: Picture his severed head on a spike.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_222.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_222.text: Good gods, what on earth makes you picture that?
CRD_SpellTeaching2_222.context: NodeContext: Gale and the player are bonded by the Weave, allowing the player to conjure an image in Gale’s head that projects your feelings towards him. In this node, the player pictured Gale’s head on a spike. He is surprised, hurt, angry and disgusted all at once.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_83.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_83.text: Picture nothing. This is a bad idea.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_177.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_177.text: A satisfying end to a wondrous experience. It's time to let go.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_118.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_118.text: You're in no mood to be so close to Gale. Release your grasp on the Weave.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_19.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_19.text: It's not quite like praying to her. She feels closer, somehow.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_226.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_226.text: Quite so. The Weave is a sensitive conduit.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_247.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_247.text: It's different, but I can definitely feel a divine kind of presence.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_107.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_107.text: It feels like a good time to call it a night.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_160.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_160.text: Think of the here and now: this unexpected moment of learning.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_220.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_220.text: Picture a place of utter peace, away from all harm and the mayhem of civilisation.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_45.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_45.text: Recall a memory of early youth, a happy family moment.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_39.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_39.text: Try to hum a familiar tune.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_102.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_102.text: Picture the perfect darkness - to be in the womb of Shar.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_202.speaker: Narrator
CRD_SpellTeaching2_202.text: *You see - or is it sense? - the presence of a woman, the woman who hovered over Gale's palm.*

CRD_SpellTeaching2_182.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_182.text: That's too abstract for my tastes. Let's just forget about it, shall we?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_153.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_153.text: I think it's a mistake to give up on the brink of success, but I cannot force your hand.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_215.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_215.text: Repeat the words, bold and proud.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_201.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_201.text: Belt the words with a little flourish on 'Ao'.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_179.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_179.text: Actually, I dislike tongue twisters. Let's just call it a night.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_84.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_84.text: Not quite. But this is the easy part. Shall we try again?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_206.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_206.text: Imitate the gesture again. Find the magic in the movement.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_124.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_124.text: Attempt the gesture again. Give it more flair.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_125.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_125.text: No, I'm sorry, but it looks like magic's not on the cards tonight. Perhaps I'm not quite the teacher I fancy myself to be.
CRD_SpellTeaching2_125.context: NodeContext: The player failed to perform the necessary steps involved in spell casting. You really wanted the player to succeed, but alas.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_121.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_121.text: In any case, don't blame yourself. Mystra can be a fickle mistress. As I'm sure you're aware.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_143.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_143.text: In any case, don't blame yourself. Mystra can be a fickle mistress. Coy to a tee.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_232.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_232.text: No, thanks. Not my cup of tea, clearly.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_250.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_250.text: I think it's a mistake to give up so easily, but I cannot force your hand.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_23.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_23.text: Actually, never mind. Magic is just not for me.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_56.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_56.text: I think it's a mistake to hold that conviction, but I cannot force your hand.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_151.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_151.text: Magic normally comes to me through prayer, but I don't mind trying.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_92.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_92.text: No, I have no interest in such magic.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_91.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_91.text: Disinterest is such a disheartening condition.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_63.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_63.text: Always a pity when opportunities slip us by.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_144.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_144.text: Is it the same for you?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_112.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_112.text: Perhaps we can share the experience by reaching into the Weave together.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_205.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_205.text: It's getting late. Perhaps another time.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_227.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_227.text: It's different for me. Not quite so intense.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_65.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_65.text: You wouldn't say that if you felt what I feel.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_240.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_240.text: Perhaps I can show you what I mean by reaching into the Weave together.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_115.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_115.text: Magic is music, poetry, and beauty. Though I suspect you and I perform it differently.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_9.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_9.text: Magic is like music. But while you need it written down, I can play by ear.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_191.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_191.text: Fair enough - though in the end we're still playing the same composition.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_210.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_210.text: My magic is both ancient and raw. Sometimes even volatile.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_94.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_94.text: Yes - as raw and ancient as the veins of Bahamut.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_192.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_192.text: Still, it is magic in its purest, most essential rapture that I'm trying to impart.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_88.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_88.text: It's less 'music and poetry', and more 'I hope I don't blow up'.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_176.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_176.text: Believe it or not, I can relate.
CRD_SpellTeaching2_176.context: NodeContext: said with a wry grin

CRD_SpellTeaching2_200.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_200.text: How narrow-minded. Magic goes far, far beyond Mystra.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_213.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_213.text: Pish posh. One might as well deny one's mother's womb as the cradle of life.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_238.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_238.text: You read too much into it. I was merely indulging in my passion.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_253.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_253.text: More or less. I was lost in... prayer of all things.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_156.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_156.text: Mystra, for indeed it was her image I conjured, commands all magic. Salvation, if such a thing exists, is hers to bestow or withhold.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_38.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_38.text: Mystra commands all magic. Salvation, if such a thing exists, is hers to bestow or withhold.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_242.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_242.text: And yet, even now, more than I fear losing my own self and soul, I fear losing my command of her art.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_22.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_22.text: I thought you wanted to show me something. Was that it?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_139.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_139.text: Whatever this is, save it for tomorrow. We have a long day ahead of us.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_120.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_120.text: The figure you conjured: who is she? Someone you miss?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_198.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_198.text: No, no. She's no one, really. I was just... practising an incantation.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_58.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_58.text: You don't have that look on your face when you're looking at 'no one'.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_140.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_140.text: What can I say? She's... She's Mystra.
CRD_SpellTeaching2_140.context: NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_75.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_75.text: In a manner of speaking, yes. I was lost in prayer of all things.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_246.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_246.text: Someone I miss and... lost, I suppose.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_145.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_145.text: Care to tell me why you were conjuring an image of the goddess?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_26.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_26.text: No special reason, really. I was just... practising an incantation.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_134.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_134.text: There's more to it than that. You were contemplating her in a way I can hardly fathom.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_236.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_236.text: For the seldom purpose of prayer.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_129.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_129.text: Were you praying to your goddess? If so, I'd be glad to join your vigil.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_114.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_114.text: Not praying. Not quite. I was just... practising an incantation.
CRD_SpellTeaching2_114.context: NodeContext: He was recalling Mystra as a lover, but doesn't say that out loud.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_3.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_3.text: No, there's more to it than that. I know devotion when I see it.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_161.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_161.text: I'm no cleric, like you are. It's different for a wizard.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_51.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_51.text: I'm no paladin, like you are. It's different for a wizard.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_54.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_54.text: So I was, praying she'd aid me.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_25.speaker: Gale
CRD_SpellTeaching2_25.text: So I was. Praying - though perhaps more accurately: pleading.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_128.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_128.text: A well-crafted illusion. Mystra would no doubt approve.

CRD_SpellTeaching2_141.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_141.text: That's the deity you wizards adore. Mystra, right?

CRD_SpellTeaching2_249.speaker: Player
CRD_SpellTeaching2_249.text: Cut it out. That spell of yours is attracting mosquitos.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: There you are, Mr Dekarios. I've been champing at the proverbial bit.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: I've something for you. A letter from Elminster himself. He was most insistent I give it to you immediately upon your return.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: Read the letter.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Narrator
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: *The letter is written in Elminster's crabbed hand. And, given his usual verbosity, is rather succinct...*
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale reads the letter (looking down at it, doesn't have to be shown)

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Weary Traveller
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: I see remaining optimistic as my duty - especially when I am not the one being asked to do the seemingly impossible.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Weary Traveller
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: Think carefully - exceedingly so. You know Mystra, as do I. I was not born an old man. I am all too familiar with what it's like to have a goddess fill your heart with longing.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Weary Traveller
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: If there is another way, I trust you can find it. It is not in your nature or mine to stop looking, to accept the first answer to any dilemma. Do what you can - put that mind to work.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Weary Traveller
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: Perhaps... perhaps that should have been your mission right from the start.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Narrator
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: *Reading between Elminster's cramped lines, you can draw only one conclusion. He thinks you should defy Mystra's instruction, and refuse to use the orb.*
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale stops reading, a look of mild concern on his face

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: What is it, darling? You look rather pale.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: Elminster's changed his tune. He thinks I shouldn't use the orb.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: Aha! Mr Aumar can always be relied upon to bring a dash of good sense to proceedings. A shame he didn't start with that, but still.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: I hope you plan to heed his advice. Carefully, though. He seemed rather fidgety when he delivered his message. Mystra will have both of you in her bad books before long.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: Oh, it's nothing. A spot of indigestion.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: And I'm a displacer beast.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: However, I will not press you further. Your private correspondence is just that, technically.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: What kind of companion would I be were I to sneak a peek?
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.context: NodeContext: A little telling, like she plans to read it later.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: It's good news. I think...

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: Good news. Well. That's good. Yes. Quite.
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.context: NodeContext: Coming around to the idea that the letter isn't bad after all.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: I admit I was dreading what might be in that letter. There's been so much dreadful news lately.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: I won't pry for specifics, Mr Dekarios. Not when I can sneak a peek at your letter while you sleep.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: Speaking of which - you ought to get your rest. Quite another day ahead of you, I'm sure.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: Any idea what he wanted?

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: One thing only: he gave the strictest instructions that this letter was for your eyes only.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: That being said, I'm sure he won't mind you indulging me with its subject matter, once you've broken the seal.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: I'll read it later.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: The most famous wizard in the realms delivers you a secret letter, and you intend to read it... some day?

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: Fine. I'll read it now.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Player
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: Well, yes, actually.

Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_CRD_LastNightAlive_FollowedMystr.text: Wrong. Go on. Now.
